abstract: A New Jersey state court has rejected Citigroup‘s bid to dismiss a $10 billion lawsuit accusing it of helping former management at Italian food company Parmalat commit fraud. The decision, by Bergen County Superior Court Judge Jonathan Harris, dismisses Citigroup’s claim that New Jersey is the wrong venue.
lead_paragraph: A New Jersey state court has rejected Citigroup‘s bid to dismiss a $10 billion lawsuit accusing it of helping former management at Italian food company Parmalat commit fraud. The decision, by Bergen County Superior Court Judge Jonathan Harris, dismisses Citigroup’s claim that New Jersey is the wrong venue.

headline.main: Court Rules Parmalat May Sue Citi in New Jersey
